description: A declarative filter to control of which data labels to display. The declarative filter is designed for use when callback functions are not available, like when the chart options require a pure JSON structure or for use with graphical editors. For programmatic control, use the formatter instead, and return undefined to disable a single data label.

children.name: operator
children.description: The operator to compare by. Can be one of >, <, >=, <=, ==, and ===.

children.name: property
children.description: The point property to filter by. Point options are passed directly to properties, additionally there are y value, percentage and others listed under {@link Highcharts.Point} members.
